snippet: With no firm date for deliveries to begin to Madaya, however, tens of thousands of people remain at risk, United Nations officials warned.
abstract: Syrian government agrees to delivery of food to Madaya, rebel-occupied town on verge of starvation; emerging humanitarian crisis within broader conflict tests durability of ad hoc cease-fires arranged by United Nations.
lead_paragraph: With no firm date for deliveries to begin to Madaya, however, tens of thousands of people remain at risk, United Nations officials warned.

headline.main: As Rebel-Held Town of Madaya Starves, Syria Agrees to Food Aid, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Syria Agrees to Food Delivery for Starving Town, U.N. Says
